content: complimentary pattern spangle cowl design by bobbi intveld pattern no for use with 202446 woolstok north/prairie for use with woolstok north/prairie super bulky/fingering spangle cowl design by bobbi intveld description a beautiful combination of woolstok north and prairie this warm and colorful cowl is a quick knit on larger needles experience level gauge in pattern 8½ sts and 12 row = 4 advanced beginner sizes finished measurements 25 one circumference 12 height materials yarn needles 10mm 24 circular needle woolstok north super bulky size 15 or size needed to obtain gauge 100% fine highland wool 150g/107yds 1 hank a prairie fingering 53% suri alpaca 47% baby huacaya alpaca 50g/273yds 1 hank b color shown color shown no 4310 no 1112 cranberry compote a sedum b other tools tapestry needle p 02 blue sky fibers notes this cowl is worked with two strands of yarn held together throughout pattern as written will use approx 146g of woolstok north and 17g of prairie step no 1 cowl with a and b held together throughout co 55 sts do not place a marker and join to work in the round being careful not to twist sts *k3 p3 repeat from * until piece meas approx 12 inches or until desired length or until 2 yards of yarn all rnds woolstok north remain bobble loosely in patt step no 2 finishing weave in ends block as desired step no 3 care hand wash or dry clean wash in tepid water using a mild soap do not twist shape and dry flat on a towel abbreviations approx approximately p purl bobble bind off repeat repeat k knit round s round s meas measures st s stitch es patt pattern * repeat the directions between the asterisks as many times as indicated p o box 88 minneapolis mn 55011 usa blueskyfibers com ©2024 this knit pattern is copyrighted material and under the copyright laws of the united states you may use this pattern for your own personal use or enjoyment but may not edit publish copy or commercially exploit this pattern in any way 11012024 p 04
